text:
Like you know, in the "Response assertion", the "patterns to test" are sensitive
to special caracters like "?",  this kind of characters are considered like a
part of regular expression.

The enhancement i propose is to add a checkbox to this screen to choose if you
want to consider your "patterns to test" as a simple text (in that case the
special caracters will not be considered as a part of régular expression) or as
a regular experssion. This choice will be applied for all "patterns to test" of
the current "Response assertion".
creator: nbekrar@jouve.fr
sebb@apache.org
text:
It seems ORO does not support \Q \E escaping, so this would be useful.

Perhaps add the "simple text" checkbox to each line, rather than having one
checkbox for all the patterns.

Likewise, for the other flags (contains/matches, not).

Might be useful to add other modifiers such as case-blind, single-line,
multi-line etc as well.
Response Assertion now supports "Equals" and "Substring" options which just compare plain text.
creator: sebb@apache.org
